{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Administrative and Operations Officer",
  "description": "Eagle Consulting Global is a multinational firm offering one-stop solutions across education, engineering, ICT, marketing, travel advisory, and business services. They provide tailored consulting from strategic planning to execution and ongoing support, helping clients streamline processes and achieve goals efficiently. The company collaborates with diverse brands and industry leaders to deliver high-quality, customized solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative and Operations Officer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT), Kaduna and Kano

Key Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Provide administrative support to the team, including scheduling appointments, managing correspondence, and maintaining records
	Ensure smooth day-to-day operations of the office
	Manage office supplies, inventory, and equipment


Operations Management:


	Oversee and coordinate operational activities, including logistics, procurement, and facilities management
	Ensure compliance with organizational policies and procedures
	Identify areas for process improvement and implement changes


Communication and Coordination:


	Liaise with internal teams, external partners, and stakeholders to ensure effective communication and coordination
	Respond to queries and resolve issues in a timely and professional manner
	Provide support for meetings, events, and other organizational activities


Data Management:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records and databases
	Ensure data confidentiality, integrity, and security


Requirement


	Proven experience in administration and operations from 3 years
	Strong organizational, time management, and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Proficiency in office software and systems (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Suite)
	Attention to detail and ability to multitask
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary, Bonuses and other benefits package
	Opportunities for career growth and development
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send your resume and cover letter to:&nbsp;info@eagleconsultingglobal.com&nbsp;and&nbsp;eagleconsultingglobal@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, contact +234 904 023 1443.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Eagle Consulting Global"
    
  },

  },

Administrative and Operations Officer Job at Eagle Consulting Global




        
    

        
        Eagle Consulting Global is a multinational firm offering one-stop solutions across education, engineering, ICT, marketing, travel advisory, and business services. They provide tailored consulting from strategic planning to execution and ongoing support, helping clients streamline processes and achieve goals efficiently. The company collaborates with diverse brands and industry leaders to deliver high-quality, customized solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative and Operations Officer

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT), Kaduna and Kano

Key Responsibilities
Administrative Support:
     

            
    




	Provide administrative support to the team, including scheduling appointments, managing correspondence, and maintaining records
	Ensure smooth day-to-day operations of the office
	Manage office supplies, inventory, and equipment


Operations Management:


	Oversee and coordinate operational activities, including logistics, procurement, and facilities management
	Ensure compliance with organizational policies and procedures
	Identify areas for process improvement and implement changes


Communication and Coordination:


	Liaise with internal teams, external partners, and stakeholders to ensure effective communication and coordination
	Respond to queries and resolve issues in a timely and professional manner
	Provide support for meetings, events, and other organizational activities


Data Management:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records and databases
	Ensure data confidentiality, integrity, and security


Requirement


	Proven experience in administration and operations from 3 years
	Strong organizational, time management, and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Proficiency in office software and systems (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Suite)
	Attention to detail and ability to multitask
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary, Bonuses and other benefits package
	Opportunities for career growth and development
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send your resume and cover letter to: info@eagleconsultingglobal.com and eagleconsultingglobal@gmail.com using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, contact +234 904 023 1443.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Clerk",
  "description": "International Breweries Plc - Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. Beer, the original social network, has been bringing people together for thousands of years. We are committed to building great brands that stand the test of time and to brewing the best beers using the finest natural ingredients.

Our diverse portfolio of well over 400 beer brands includes global brands Budweiser, Corona and Stella Artois; multi-country brands Beck&rsquo;s, Castle, Castle Lite, Hoegaarden, and Leffe; and local champions such as Aguila, Bud Light, Jupiler, Klinskoye, Modelo Especial, Quilmes, Skol, and Victoria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Inventory Clerk

Job Requisition ID:&nbsp;30087745
Job Location:&nbsp;Ilorin, Kwara
Job Type:&nbsp;Full-time

Summary


	The Key Purpose of this role is to ensure all governance processes and documentation are followed and completed and that any and all physical movement of inventory is correctly reflected in SAP inventory differences investigated, resolved &amp; reported.


Key Roles &amp; Responsibilities
The key accountabilities for this role include but are not restricted to:

Finished Goods &amp; Raw Material Quality Management:


	Population and Reporting on Blocked Stock Tracker for Finished Goods, Empties and Raw Materials as per BCA/LSA and MICs Requirements.
	Ensure Compliance Finished Goods and Raw Materials Inventory Quality Fundamental standards.


Stock Age Management:


	Population and Reporting Obsolescence Tracker for Finished Goods and Raw Materials as per BCA/LSA and MICS Requirements
	Apply for Inventory Concessions as per Policy
	All Obsolescence Stock is Decanted /Discarded as per Global Policy &amp; procedure.


Inventory Management of Finished Goods, Empties and Raw Materials;


	Pre Count Reports to be Reviewed and Cleared.
	Reconcile that all GRNs have taken place (e.g.Raw Materials, New Glass and Crates and Market Place)
	STO In-transit Reports are clear of ageing Shipments
	Virtual Warehouse cleared and only reflects Current Production on both Finished Goods and Empties
	All Transfers Between Raw Materials Warehouses and Packaging/Brewing Process Areas are reconciled (Transfer Documentation vs ERP)
	Verification that 3 Point Checks were conducted on all Inbound and Outbound Shipments/Load
	Daily Reconciliation to ERP of Independent Inventory Counts conducted on all SKUs and Material Codes
	Inventory Count Differences Identified, Investigated and Reported
	Inventory Count Differences escalated to Warehouse Controller to develop Commentary, Problem Solving &amp; Action Plans to be reported to BLM/DCLM.
	Post Count Reports and Inventory Pack is signed and reviewed with the BLM Daily.


Breakages Management:


	Verification Full Beer Breakages , RGB Breakages, Raw Materials Breakages , Pallet Destruction and Crate Write Offs are processed in SAP in the Correct GL
	Reconciliation between Breakages Register and SAP.


Returns PO Management:


	
	3 Way Match verification on RTP Returns &ndash; Source Documentation to SAP.
	


MBFU:


	
	Quality and Accuracy checks on Capturing of MBFU in MBFU Portal.
	


Inbound Losses:


	Following up on Open Claims
	Scan and Upload POD and Claims to Share-point
	Reporting and Reviewing RSC and BIT Charges with Carriers to ensure alignment daily.


Diesel:


	Expensing of Diesel in ERP
	Transact Diesel Reconciliation (Physical vs SAP) through MI20.


Governance and Risk:


	All Documentation signed-off by relevant persons, filed &amp; securely stored as per Inventory Control Policy &ndash; e.g. Inventory stock packs, T1 &amp; T2 shipment packs, Gate Register, etc
	Ensure implementation and compliance of VPO Excellence Programs.


Minimum Requirements


	BSc / HND in Relevant Discipline
	Min - 2 - 3 years of experience in a Stock Control environment.


Key Attributes &amp; Competencies:


	MS Office proficiency
	Attention to detail
	High level of accuracy
	Ability to manage self
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
	Sound knowledge of the SAP system
	Good verbal ability and communication skills
	High levels of Integrity and ethics
	Excellent knowledge of Stock Control processes.


Additional Information:


	
	BAND: XI.
	
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-13",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "International Breweries Plc"
    
  },

      "maxValue": 0,

    }
  }

Inventory Clerk Job at International Breweries Plc




        
    

        
        International Breweries Plc - Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. Beer, the original social network, has been bringing people together for thousands of years. We are committed to building great brands that stand the test of time and to brewing the best beers using the finest natural ingredients.

Our diverse portfolio of well over 400 beer brands includes global brands Budweiser, Corona and Stella Artois; multi-country brands Beck’s, Castle, Castle Lite, Hoegaarden, and Leffe; and local champions such as Aguila, Bud Light, Jupiler, Klinskoye, Modelo Especial, Quilmes, Skol, and Victoria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Clerk
     

            
    



Job Requisition ID: 30087745
Job Location: Ilorin, Kwara
Job Type: Full-time

Summary


	The Key Purpose of this role is to ensure all governance processes and documentation are followed and completed and that any and all physical movement of inventory is correctly reflected in SAP inventory differences investigated, resolved & reported.


Key Roles & Responsibilities
The key accountabilities for this role include but are not restricted to:

Finished Goods & Raw Material Quality Management:


	Population and Reporting on Blocked Stock Tracker for Finished Goods, Empties and Raw Materials as per BCA/LSA and MICs Requirements.
	Ensure Compliance Finished Goods and Raw Materials Inventory Quality Fundamental standards.


Stock Age Management:


	Population and Reporting Obsolescence Tracker for Finished Goods and Raw Materials as per BCA/LSA and MICS Requirements
	Apply for Inventory Concessions as per Policy
	All Obsolescence Stock is Decanted /Discarded as per Global Policy & procedure.


Inventory Management of Finished Goods, Empties and Raw Materials;


	Pre Count Reports to be Reviewed and Cleared.
	Reconcile that all GRNs have taken place (e.g.Raw Materials, New Glass and Crates and Market Place)
	STO In-transit Reports are clear of ageing Shipments
	Virtual Warehouse cleared and only reflects Current Production on both Finished Goods and Empties
	All Transfers Between Raw Materials Warehouses and Packaging/Brewing Process Areas are reconciled (Transfer Documentation vs ERP)
	Verification that 3 Point Checks were conducted on all Inbound and Outbound Shipments/Load
	Daily Reconciliation to ERP of Independent Inventory Counts conducted on all SKUs and Material Codes
	Inventory Count Differences Identified, Investigated and Reported
	Inventory Count Differences escalated to Warehouse Controller to develop Commentary, Problem Solving & Action Plans to be reported to BLM/DCLM.
	Post Count Reports and Inventory Pack is signed and reviewed with the BLM Daily.


Breakages Management:


	Verification Full Beer Breakages , RGB Breakages, Raw Materials Breakages , Pallet Destruction and Crate Write Offs are processed in SAP in the Correct GL
	Reconciliation between Breakages Register and SAP.


Returns PO Management:


	
	3 Way Match verification on RTP Returns – Source Documentation to SAP.
	


MBFU:


	
	Quality and Accuracy checks on Capturing of MBFU in MBFU Portal.
	


Inbound Losses:


	Following up on Open Claims
	Scan and Upload POD and Claims to Share-point
	Reporting and Reviewing RSC and BIT Charges with Carriers to ensure alignment daily.


Diesel:


	Expensing of Diesel in ERP
	Transact Diesel Reconciliation (Physical vs SAP) through MI20.


Governance and Risk:


	All Documentation signed-off by relevant persons, filed & securely stored as per Inventory Control Policy – e.g. Inventory stock packs, T1 & T2 shipment packs, Gate Register, etc
	Ensure implementation and compliance of VPO Excellence Programs.


Minimum Requirements


	BSc / HND in Relevant Discipline
	Min - 2 - 3 years of experience in a Stock Control environment.


Key Attributes & Competencies:


	MS Office proficiency
	Attention to detail
	High level of accuracy
	Ability to manage self
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
	Sound knowledge of the SAP system
	Good verbal ability and communication skills
	High levels of Integrity and ethics
	Excellent knowledge of Stock Control processes.


Additional Information:


	
	BAND: XI.
	
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Operations Support Job at DMV Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        DMV Nigeria Limited was incorporated in 2001 as a facility maintenance company but started Power Generating Business in 2014. At DMV Nigeria Limited, we are a generator service company with head office in Lekki, Lagos Nigeria and other site offices located all across the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Support

Job Location: Ajah / Adesanya, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibility


	To support the operations of the technical team.


Qualifications
     

            
    




	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree with 1 - 3 years of work experience.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: customerservice.dmvltd@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Brand Manager",
  "description": "Montaigne Place is Nigeria&#39;s largest luxury skincare, cosmetic, fragrance, and well-being retail company. Founded on the vision to provide luxury at its best, Montaigne Place provides an exceptional sophisticated shopping experience with our exclusive offers. Montaigne Place currently has luxury retail outlets across Nigeria. Our brand&#39;s portfolio cuts across different categories.ls with beauty, wellness and cosmetics.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Duties &amp; Responsibilities


	Formulate brand&rsquo;s long-term strategy to effectively reach customers
	Responsible for 360degree marketing communications plan &amp; tactics covering ATL, BTL, Digital and Influencer marketing
	Oversees the brand&rsquo;s marketing life cycle
	Manages day-to-day progress of product marketing planning and execution
	Maintains brand integrity across product lines, advertising,digital ` and all other internal and external communication as it pertains to assigned brand
	Collaborates with a wide variety of functional areas such as sales, editorial, marketing, design, and operations to execute specific marketing plans
	Conducts market research and identifies and tracks market trends
	Define and manage the brand&rsquo;s advertising and promotion strategies
	Closely monitor and analyze sales volumes, market share trends and general market drivers
	Advise management of competitive pricing, promotions, sales trends and other competitive activity as well as a reasonable action plan
	Ensure all sales team members are well trained and knowledgeable about brand
	Provide monthly brand reports &amp; updates to managemen.


Minimum Education Qualifications


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in any business-related discipline.
	2-3 years of field field experience in brand management and or in marketing communications of reputable brands.


Salary
N700,000 - N800,000 per month.&nbsp;",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Montaigne Place"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "186844"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 600000,
      "maxValue": 900000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Brand Manager Job at Montaigne Place




        
    

        
        Montaigne Place is Nigeria's largest luxury skincare, cosmetic, fragrance, and well-being retail company. Founded on the vision to provide luxury at its best, Montaigne Place provides an exceptional sophisticated shopping experience with our exclusive offers. Montaigne Place currently has luxury retail outlets across Nigeria. Our brand's portfolio cuts across different categories.ls with beauty, wellness and cosmetics.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager
Job Location: Lagos

Duties & Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Formulate brand’s long-term strategy to effectively reach customers
	Responsible for 360degree marketing communications plan & tactics covering ATL, BTL, Digital and Influencer marketing
	Oversees the brand’s marketing life cycle
	Manages day-to-day progress of product marketing planning and execution
	Maintains brand integrity across product lines, advertising,digital ` and all other internal and external communication as it pertains to assigned brand
	Collaborates with a wide variety of functional areas such as sales, editorial, marketing, design, and operations to execute specific marketing plans
	Conducts market research and identifies and tracks market trends
	Define and manage the brand’s advertising and promotion strategies
	Closely monitor and analyze sales volumes, market share trends and general market drivers
	Advise management of competitive pricing, promotions, sales trends and other competitive activity as well as a reasonable action plan
	Ensure all sales team members are well trained and knowledgeable about brand
	Provide monthly brand reports & updates to managemen.


Minimum Education Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s degree in any business-related discipline.
	2-3 years of field field experience in brand management and or in marketing communications of reputable brands.


Salary
N700,000 - N800,000 per month.     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Contact Center Agent",
  "description": "ICS Outsourcing Limited is Nigeria&rsquo;s leading Outsourcing Company and Business Support Solutions provider. We offer a comprehensive range of outsourcing services ranging from People Outsourcing to Sales BPO to all kinds and sizes of business. Value added services to our client&rsquo;s has is our desire. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing our client&rsquo;s expectations. We are one of the Top indigenous Companies in Nigeria to work for. Outsourcing in Nigeria, Outsource To Nigeria, Top Companies in Nigeria, Nigeria, outsourcing company in Nigeria, top outsourcing company in Nigeria, top, list of outsourcing company in Nigeria, outsourcing firms in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Contact Center Agent

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Days: Monday to Friday

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused Contact Center Agent to join our client team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for handling inbound and outbound calls, providing excellent customer service, resolving inquiries, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
	This role requires strong communication skills, patience, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Answer inbound calls and respond to customer inquiries in a professional manner.
	Make outbound calls to follow up on customer issues, surveys, or campaigns.
	Resolve customer complaints efficiently and escalate complex issues when necessary.
	Provide accurate information about products, services, and company policies.
	Maintain detailed and accurate records of customer interactions in the CRM system.
	Meet or exceed daily/weekly performance targets (e.g., call handling time, resolution rate).
	Collaborate with team members to improve service delivery and customer experience.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / NCE qualification; Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree is an added advantage.
	Previous experience in a call center, customer service, or related field preferred.
	Excellent communication and active listening skills.
	Ability to multitask, manage time, and handle pressure effectively.
	Proficiency in MS Office and CRM software.
	Strong problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills.
	Proximity to the job location is very important. Candidates living close by will be given preference.


Salary
N100,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs to:&nbsp;aawosanya@icsoutsourcing.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Contact Center Agent&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-09",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "ICS Outsourcing Limited"
    
  },

Contact Center Agent Job at ICS Outsourcing Limited




        
    

        
        ICS Outsourcing Limited is Nigeria’s leading Outsourcing Company and Business Support Solutions provider. We offer a comprehensive range of outsourcing services ranging from People Outsourcing to Sales BPO to all kinds and sizes of business. Value added services to our client’s has is our desire. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing our client’s expectations. We are one of the Top indigenous Companies in Nigeria to work for. Outsourcing in Nigeria, Outsource To Nigeria, Top Companies in Nigeria, Nigeria, outsourcing company in Nigeria, top outsourcing company in Nigeria, top, list of outsourcing company in Nigeria, outsourcing firms in Nigeria.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Contact Center Agent

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Days: Monday to Friday

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused Contact Center Agent to join our client team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for handling inbound and outbound calls, providing excellent customer service, resolving inquiries, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
	This role requires strong communication skills, patience, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Answer inbound calls and respond to customer inquiries in a professional manner.
	Make outbound calls to follow up on customer issues, surveys, or campaigns.
	Resolve customer complaints efficiently and escalate complex issues when necessary.
	Provide accurate information about products, services, and company policies.
	Maintain detailed and accurate records of customer interactions in the CRM system.
	Meet or exceed daily/weekly performance targets (e.g., call handling time, resolution rate).
	Collaborate with team members to improve service delivery and customer experience.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / NCE qualification; Bachelor’s Degree is an added advantage.
	Previous experience in a call center, customer service, or related field preferred.
	Excellent communication and active listening skills.
	Ability to multitask, manage time, and handle pressure effectively.
	Proficiency in MS Office and CRM software.
	Strong problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills.
	Proximity to the job location is very important. Candidates living close by will be given preference.


Salary
N100,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs to: aawosanya@icsoutsourcing.com using “Contact Center Agent” as the subject of the mail.
